trans-unit.source: Add Caching to improve performance in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: Add Caching to improve performance in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to improve the latency, bandwidth consumption, and web service load for API Management service calls.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to improve the latency, bandwidth consumption, and web service load for API Management service calls.

trans-unit.source: Add Caching to improve performance in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: Add Caching to improve performance in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Operations in API Management can be configured for response caching.
trans-unit.target: Operations in API Management can be configured for response caching.

trans-unit.source: Response caching can significantly reduce API latency, bandwidth consumption, and web service load for data that does not change frequently.
trans-unit.target: Response caching can significantly reduce API latency, bandwidth consumption, and web service load for data that does not change frequently.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to add response caching for your API and configure policies for the sample Echo Api operations.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to add response caching for your API and configure policies for the sample Echo Api operations.

trans-unit.source: You can then call the operation from the developer portal to verify caching in action.
trans-unit.target: You can then call the operation from the developer portal to verify caching in action.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before following the steps in this this guide you must have an API Management service instance with an API and a Product configured.
trans-unit.target: Before following the steps in this this guide you must have an API Management service instance with an API and a Product configured.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, please see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, please see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Configure an operation for caching
trans-unit.target: Configure an operation for caching

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will review the caching settings of the **GET Resource (cached)** operation of the sample Echo Api.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will review the caching settings of the **GET Resource (cached)** operation of the sample Echo Api.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Each API Management service instance comes pre-configured with an Echo API that can be used to experiment with and learn about API Management.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Each API Management service instance comes pre-configured with an Echo API that can be used to experiment with and learn about API Management.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with Azure API Management][].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with Azure API Management][].

trans-unit.source: To get started, click **Manage** in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click **Manage** in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: Publisher portal
trans-unit.target: Publisher portal

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and click **Echo API**.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and click **Echo API**.

trans-unit.source: Echo API
trans-unit.target: Echo API

trans-unit.source: Select the **Operations** tab, and click the **GET Resource (cached)** operation from the **Operations** list.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Operations** tab, and click the **GET Resource (cached)** operation from the **Operations** list.

trans-unit.source: Echo API operations
trans-unit.target: Echo API operations

trans-unit.source: Select the **Caching** tab to view the caching settings for this operation.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Caching** tab to view the caching settings for this operation.

trans-unit.source: Caching tab
trans-unit.target: Caching tab

trans-unit.source: To enable caching for an operation, check the **Enable** checkbox.
trans-unit.target: To enable caching for an operation, check the **Enable** checkbox.

trans-unit.source: In this example caching is enabled.
trans-unit.target: In this example caching is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Each operation response is keyed based on the values in the **Vary by query string parameters** and **Vary by headers** fields.
trans-unit.target: Each operation response is keyed based on the values in the **Vary by query string parameters** and **Vary by headers** fields.

trans-unit.source: If you want to cache multiple responses based on query string parameters or headers, you can configure them in these two fields.
trans-unit.target: If you want to cache multiple responses based on query string parameters or headers, you can configure them in these two fields.

trans-unit.source: **Duration** specifies the expiration interval of the cached responses.
trans-unit.target: **Duration** specifies the expiration interval of the cached responses.

trans-unit.source: In this example the interval is **3600** seconds, which is equivalent to one hour.
trans-unit.target: In this example the interval is **3600** seconds, which is equivalent to one hour.

trans-unit.source: Using the caching configuration in this example, the first request to the **GET Resource (cached)** operation will return a response from the back-end service.
trans-unit.target: Using the caching configuration in this example, the first request to the **GET Resource (cached)** operation will return a response from the back-end service.

trans-unit.source: This response will be cached, keyed by the specified headers and query string parameters.
trans-unit.target: This response will be cached, keyed by the specified headers and query string parameters.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent calls to the operation, with matching parameters, will have the cached response returned, until the cache duration interval has expired.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent calls to the operation, with matching parameters, will have the cached response returned, until the cache duration interval has expired.

trans-unit.source: Review the caching policies
trans-unit.target: Review the caching policies

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will review the caching settings for the **GET Resource (cached)** operation of the sample Echo Api.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will review the caching settings for the **GET Resource (cached)** operation of the sample Echo Api.

trans-unit.source: When caching settings are configured for an operation on the **Caching** tab, caching policies are added for the operation.
trans-unit.target: When caching settings are configured for an operation on the **Caching** tab, caching policies are added for the operation.

trans-unit.source: These policies can be viewed and edited in the policy editor.
trans-unit.target: These policies can be viewed and edited in the policy editor.

trans-unit.source: Click **Policies** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and select **Echo API / GET Resource (cached)** from the **Operation** drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Click **Policies** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and select **Echo API / GET Resource (cached)** from the **Operation** drop-down.

trans-unit.source: Policy scope operation
trans-unit.target: Policy scope operation

trans-unit.source: This displays the policies for this operation in the policy editor.
trans-unit.target: This displays the policies for this operation in the policy editor.

trans-unit.source: API Management policy editor
trans-unit.target: API Management policy editor

trans-unit.source: The policy definition for this operation includes the policies that define the caching configuration that were reviewed using the **Caching** tab in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: The policy definition for this operation includes the policies that define the caching configuration that were reviewed using the **Caching** tab in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Changes made to the caching policies in the policy editor will reflect in the **Caching** tab of an operation, and vice-versa.
trans-unit.target: Changes made to the caching policies in the policy editor will reflect in the **Caching** tab of an operation, and vice-versa.

trans-unit.source: Call an operation and test the caching
trans-unit.target: Call an operation and test the caching

trans-unit.source: To see the caching in action, we can call the operation from the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: To see the caching in action, we can call the operation from the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **Developer portal** in the top right menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **Developer portal** in the top right menu.

trans-unit.source: Developer portal
trans-unit.target: Developer portal

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** in the top menu and select **Echo API**.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** in the top menu and select **Echo API**.

trans-unit.source: Echo API
trans-unit.target: Echo API

trans-unit.source: If you have only one API configured or visible to your account, then clicking APIs takes you directly to the operations for that API.
trans-unit.target: If you have only one API configured or visible to your account, then clicking APIs takes you directly to the operations for that API.

trans-unit.source: Select the **GET Resource (cached)** operation and click **Open Console**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **GET Resource (cached)** operation and click **Open Console**.

trans-unit.source: Open console
trans-unit.target: Open console

trans-unit.source: The console allows you to invoke operations directly from the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: The console allows you to invoke operations directly from the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: Console
trans-unit.target: Console

trans-unit.source: Keep the default values for **param1** and **param2**.
trans-unit.target: Keep the default values for **param1** and **param2**.

trans-unit.source: Select the desired key from the **subscription-key** drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired key from the **subscription-key** drop-down.

trans-unit.source: If your account has only one subscription it will already be selected.
trans-unit.target: If your account has only one subscription it will already be selected.

trans-unit.source: Enter **sampleheader:value1** in the **Request headers** text box.
trans-unit.target: Enter **sampleheader:value1** in the **Request headers** text box.

trans-unit.source: Click **HTTP Get** and make a note of the response headers.
trans-unit.target: Click **HTTP Get** and make a note of the response headers.

trans-unit.source: Enter **sampleheader:value2** in the **Request headers** text box and click **HTTP Get**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **sampleheader:value2** in the **Request headers** text box and click **HTTP Get**.

trans-unit.source: Note that the value of **sampleheader** is still **value1** in the response.
trans-unit.target: Note that the value of **sampleheader** is still **value1** in the response.

trans-unit.source: Try some different values and note that the cached response from the first call is returned.
trans-unit.target: Try some different values and note that the cached response from the first call is returned.

trans-unit.source: Enter **25** into the **param2** field, and click **HTTP Get**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **25** into the **param2** field, and click **HTTP Get**.

trans-unit.source: Note that the value of **sampleheader** in the response is now **value2**.
trans-unit.target: Note that the value of **sampleheader** in the response is now **value2**.

trans-unit.source: Because the operation results are keyed by query string, the previous cached response was not returned.
trans-unit.target: Because the operation results are keyed by query string, the previous cached response was not returned.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Check out the other topics in the [Get started with advanced API configuration][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Check out the other topics in the [Get started with advanced API configuration][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For more information on caching policies, see [Caching policies][] in the [API Management policy reference][].
trans-unit.target: For more information on caching policies, see [Caching policies][] in the [API Management policy reference][].

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
